results.definition: hasty and without attention to detail; not thorough
a bodily reaction of changing from one place or stage to another
success in satisfying a test or requirement
examples: his future depended on his passing that test

results.definition: going by something that is moving in order to get in front of it
examples: she drove but well but her reckless passing of every car on the road frightened me

results.definition: of advancing the ball by throwing it
examples: a team with a good passing attack
she was a surpassingly beautiful woman
I will mention only one particular aspect of the current mess because ... this one is surely something new and passing strange

results.definition: the motion of one object relative to another
examples: stellar passings can perturb the orbits of comets

results.definition: (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
examples: the coach sent in a passing play on third and long

results.definition: allowing you to pass (e.g., an examination or inspection) satisfactorily
